Posts.Content: I'm glad I could make you feel better. Im going to sneak my email in here and maybe you can email me before they catch it. You can find me at kidznkim on hotmail and yahoo I also have messanger. The taxatere gave me neruopathy... the numbness in your legs and the pain. I was on neurotin but it didnt help. I have learned to deal with it. Feels like little ant crawling from my calf down 24/7. I do take tylenol 3 as needed. I have two disabled children. one is 17 and in a wheelchair. So I do alot of lifting. Thats how we found the bone cancer. I thought I had pulled something in my tailbone. after a couple of months it was still there. Not a bad pain... just felt like a bruise. But because of my history and my amazing family doc he ordered me to have a bone scan. Thats when it showed up on one rib and pelvic. I had just had my 2 year check up and all my blood work was fine. Shows how much thats shows you. then a pet scan was ordered. From what I understand it will show cancer anywhere. After 3 months of hormonal treatment the oet scan showed it had shrunk in the tailbone and the spot on the rib was gone. Then this last scan had nothing on it. I still feel pain. But still like a bruise. But im like you with all the joint pain I would swear it had spread all over me. So now I have a scan in 6 months. Its so hard living like this. You just never know. My son that has autism said mon its like a volcano just dont know when it will erupt. He said it might stay dormant for a 100 years....hahaha I pray alot, I stay positive as much as I can. But I also have my nights when I just want to cry when nobody is around. My babie's need me and i will fight as long as I can. When this stops working i will have chemo again. That is something im not looking forward to. I have had all the chemo's you mentioned and cytoxin was the easiest. the other two are so hard. I havent had the xeloda. I dont know anything about that med. But as long as this is working and I pray for a long time. Im not making any changes. My oncologist, sister has been in remission 9 years from breast cancer after it had spread to her bone and liver. So I hold onto that. I would love to talk to someone that has had simular situation as mine that has been in remission a long time. Hopefully you catch my email on here... Like I said its kidznkim at either hotmail or yahoo.... same name on both. Look forward to talking to you. God bless Kim
Posts.Title: Hair Loss From Femera

Posts.Content: I am on femera now. Ihave been since feb of this year. This is my thrid time with breast cancer but this time it has spread to the bone. I also had severe joint pain and hair loss. I had a full head of hair when I started this med. But it is thining out. Not enough for anyone to notice but still. But I have to tell you no matter the die effects I think femera is my miracle drug. That along with zometa and a lupron shot. I have done the chemo in the past so they are trying a differant treatment. After 8 months i am now in remission. SO keep taking femera. Being a woman losing our hair and breast is so hard. esp when you are young. I am 41 and going on 10 years of fighting this. But i will fight it 20 more years breastless and hairless if the medication works. get a short hair cut.. Do a cute sassy look. Thats what I did and it looks thicker. But ask your hairdresser and see what they say. But dont get down about the hair. If that goes along with the cancer....Its worth it. God bless you and hang in there Kim
Posts.Title: Hair Loss From Femera

Posts.Content: I just read your message and it gave me hope. I have been fighting breast cancer for 10 years. This is my third time. Last year it spread to the pelvic. This means stage 4 and non curable. I am now in remission. But I cant help thinking everyday is this the day it will come back. My doc wont give me a time of how long I have. I guess im someone that needs to know. I have two disabled children I need to find a home for. But your mom being in stage 4 for 9 years gives me hope. i thought I might only have a year or so. I would love to hear from anyone that has been in remission for a long time. Im only 41. This all started when I was 31 and I had a right side mastectomy then with chemo. 5 years later it came back in the primary aread and I had chemo, radiation and meds. Now its just femera and zometa and a shot every 4 months called something lupron. It worked right away and I was in remission within months. But im so scared.
Posts.Title: Breast to lung to bone

Posts.Content: I just read your message and it gave me hope. I have been fighting breast cancer for 10 years. This is my third time. Last year it spread to the pelvic. This means stage 4 and non curable. I am now in remission. But I cant help thinking everyday is this the day it will come back. My doc wont give me a time of how long I have. I guess im someone that needs to know. I have two disabled children I need to find a home for. But your mom being in stage 4 for 9 years gives me hope. i thought I might only have a year or so. I would love to hear from anyone that has been in remission for a long time. Im only 41. This all started when I was 31 and I had a right side mastectomy then with chemo. 5 years later it came back in the primary aread and I had chemo, radiation and meds. Now its just femera and zometa and a shot every 4 months called something lupron. It worked right away and I was in remission within months. But im so scared.
Posts.Title: Breast to lung to bone

Posts.Content: I did the same thing. I only took my tamoxifen for 3 years. I was gaining weight from it. Going through a divorce and I just knew I was cured cause the cancer was found so early. Although I did have my breast removed. The cancer came back 5 years later in the primary area. So it was more chemo and radiation and back on tamoxifen. Now it has spread to my bone. This all started 10 years ago when I was 31 with stage 1 cancer. I am in remission now and I make sure I take my meds everyday I dont care what the side effects are. I can only wonder if I would be still fighting this 10 years later if only I had stayed on the tamoxifen that I hated so much. I can tell you it was much easier then chemo and bone cancer. So put alot of thought into it before you decide to just not take meds. Find a doctor you trust and can beleive in. Good luck and god bless you Kim
Posts.Title: Refusing Arimidex

Posts.Content: Im glad you decided to take the meds. Everyone feels differant what treatment to take. But if you find a doc you can believe in you are on the right track. I trust my doc enough that if he told me jumpinjg jacks would cure it I would do it. No the meds arent easy and you will have side effects. But you know its better then it comming back. I wish I would have listend 10 years ago. Good luck to you and god bless. Keep comming here for questions. It has helped me alot. Kim
Posts.Title: Refusing Arimidex

Posts.Content: YES !!! I have terrible pain. I am 42 I also have bone mets, but in remission. Im also on femera. From what I have read pain is a side effect. Nothing seems to help the pain and I walk like im 90 sometimes. But pain is someting I can handle if the meds are keeping the cancer away.  God bless   kim
Posts.Title: Bone Pain

Posts.Content: On 3/9/2007 Maddy wrote:   On 2/28/2007 Patti46 wrote: Hi.  I am really scared.  Had breast cancer and now have been diagnosed with the cancer in both my lungs.  I am in pain and coughing a lot.  Oncologist did the lung biopsy and I was called in yesterday for results.  He started me on Femura or something like that and I take it once a day.  He wants to start on it and see if it shrinks the cancer and not do the chemo (agressive) until later because if this works, it will prolong the chemo.  I am scared because it seems like we should start out agressive first.  I am having a hard time breathing also.  He says the pill takes several months to start shrinking the cancer.  Has anyone else had a similar experience with all this?  Let me know if this is the correct approach or if I should be on agressive chemo to start with.  THanks so much for your help, Patti I also have breast cancer, diagnosed in 2004, bilateral masectomy in 2005.  Started Armidex in 2005 and stopped in 2006.  What I have learned on this long journey is obtain as many opinions as your insurance will cover.  If my cancer returns, I would definitely go to the MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston, TX for tests and treatment recommendations.   There is an organization that flies cancer patients around the country for free.  What I do know about aramatose inhibitors (Femura/Arimidex) is that these  drugs slow the production of estrogen in your body, which feeds breast cancer cells in many patients.  I have never heard of it shrinking the cancer.  I would definitely get another opinion - and make sure you go to a major cancer center.  This is YOUR life, not the oncologist's life.  When I started my long road to recovery, I had several opinions from cancer surgeons, oncologists and radiologists.  I made an informed decision after researching everything I could.  I don't know how old you are, but you have to take ownership of your recovery.  No one else will care as much as you do.  I remember you in my prayers.  Madeline  First I want to say im sorry your cancer spread. I got breast cancer at 31, It came back at age 36. Still in the primary area. Well last year at age 41 it has spread to my bone and one rib. I was also put on Femera and zometa (stregthens the bone) and a lupron shot every 4 months. The femera stops the cancer from feeding on the estrogen. After 3 months the spot on the rib was gone and the one on pelvic had shrunk. At 6 months I was in remssion. I am still in remission that I know of. I got back next month for a pet scan to see how everything is going. I feel about the same. Of course mentally im going nuts. Femera did make my joints hurt, thinned my hair and im tired alot. But if it keeps me in remission thats a small price to pay. I think they go for the aggressive treatment when you first have cancer. When it comes back the docs try whats working best in general. That way when that stops working you go to the big stuff. Im not sure once you have chemo now you could go back to the femera. So give it a chance. If I stay in remission for a few years on this and its working great. Alot easier then chemo. My oncologist, sister has had mets from breast cancer 9 years and in remission still. I hope this helps you some. I think the worst thing about mets is mentally. Just knowing it can come back at anytime. All we can do is pray and trust our doctors. I heard this week another med came out for advanced breast cancer, It looks very promising. We may never have a cure. But maybe we can live with it a long time. Good luck to you and god bless. But femera is working on me.
Posts.Title: mets to my lungs now

Posts.Content: Im 41 and have been fighting breast cancer for 10 years. Last year it spread to my pelvic area and one rib. I am on zometa once a month. its a drip that takes about 30 minutes. It makes the bones stronger. Side effects have been some bone pain. Im also on femera. One pill everyday to stop estrogen. Help me go into menapause. Side effect being tired, thining hair. I also take a shot every 4 months. Its called something lupron. It alsois to help with menapause. I can tell you the side effects from these treatments is noway as bad as chemo or radiation. I would try it. Maybe go to another oncologist. But dont stop fighting. She might be in the percentage that stays in remission for years. I am now in remission and was with in months of treatment. Im still scared everyday when i feel a pain if its back. I have a petscan in a couple months to see. Good luck and I will pray for you and your mom.
Posts.Title: Bone mets and stopping treatment

Posts.Content: Has anyone heard of this ? My cousin is fighting Breast cancer. I also have stage 4 breast cancer. She was told after Chemo she would be have a "t" treatment. She ask me what it was since I have been fighting breast cancer for 11 years. I have never heard of it. Anyone know ?  Her treatment is so differant then mine was 11 years ago, my first diagnosis. From what I understand she has a 3cm tumor and no nodes involed. It hadnt spread. But im starting to wonder if she is hiding the true diagnosis to protect her mother. She said this T treatment is a shot every week for 12 weeks. That it has the same effects as chemo. Thanks again, Im just confused.    Kim
Posts.Title: "T" Treatment

Posts.Content: I just had my first pet scan since I have been on femera and Zometa and a depo lupron shot. It has been 4 months since diagnosed with the bone mets. I have been fighting breast cancer for 10 years. Ijust want to tell anyone that is having side effects on any of these meds. HANG IN THERE !! It worked for me. Spot on ribs is GONE, spot size of penny on the pelvis (tushy) is now just a spec. maybe the next 4 months will bring me remission. I know the bone aches from femera, hot flashes, fatigue.. But its all worth it if it stops this ugly disease. My theory is there is always something new comming out to fight this. Maybe this will get me through until the next med comes out. I just want to give someone hope. Iknow how bad we need it during this time. Anyone that would like to email me and discuss this is welcome. --- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, email address removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html ---- I think talking about it helps relieves the stress. I also have two disabled children to take care on my own. So If I can do it anyone can. hugssss to all Kim
Posts.Title: 40 With Stage 4 Breast,with Bone Metts

Posts.Content: Im sorry to hear about your mother. There are so many treatments out there. If it has spread to the bone there is no cure. But she may go into remission. My onc sister has mets to the bone and lung for 9 years now. She adopted a baby a few years ago. She gives me hope. I thought the same thing that when it spread to the bone it was a death sentance. But now days its not. Everyone beleives in differant treatments. I trust my doc (of course he is the best in the world to me)...I do as he says and try what he wants me to do. But staying positive is a huge plus. Tell her not to give up. I will never give up no matter the side effects from a med. If it is working the side effects are worth it.
Posts.Title: 40 With Stage 4 Breast,with Bone Metts

Posts.Content: Thanks, your right its like a crap shoot. Its so hard living like this. Never knowing. But at least I can say living and that is alot.
Posts.Title: in Remission

Posts.Content: One think i dont have is a good diet. I wish I did. But to be honest when I was diagnosed this last time of course I thought it was the end. I enjoed all my favorites. I do have a strong beleif in God and I know he wants me here to care for thses two disbabled children of mine. I am all they have. I dont get alot of rest. But maybe thats good. They keep me going. I dont have time to feel sorry for myself. The treatments are getting easier. Not as much pain. But extremely tired. But I will check out that website. It sure wont hurt. But the diet has to include cookiedough ice cream...hahaha I think staying positive is a healing process itself. Dont get me wrong I have my days I cry and cry. But again I beleive that is good. Letting go of the stress. Thank you and I will go to the website. Keep smiling Kim
Posts.Title: 40 With Stage 4 Breast,with Bone Metts

Posts.Content: Dont ever give up !!!! I know sometimes I feel like it. But I never will. I might fight this for 10 more years. I hope anyway.
Posts.Title: 40 With Stage 4 Breast,with Bone Metts

Posts.Content: Stay positive. I know inflamatory breast cancer is tough. But you hang in there and wait for the next new med to come out. Something new is out all the time. MAybe we can be cured. but now days you can live with cancer. Not the way we wanted to live. But I will take it. I will take the pain, fatique whatever it takes just to be here. I am lucky enough to have a wonderful b/f that understands when im just to tired to do anything but sleep. Finding someone you can talk to that understands helps. I hate always complaining to him or family. I found a friend on here that has helped me so much. Just to be able to complain and her understand how I really feel. --- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, email address removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html ----Im here if you ever want to just cry,vent or talk to. We can beat this. I know it !!! God bless kim
Posts.Title: 40 With Stage 4 Breast,with Bone Metts

Posts.Content: I have been fighting breast cancer for 10 years. Started at age 31. Came back in 2002 in primary site. We thought once again it was cured. This year it came backin the bone. Two spots, one on rib and one on pelvic. Well I went on hormonal therapy. Zometa, lupron shot and femera. First petscan showed it had shrunk. This last one showed nothing. I can still feel the pain in the area I had it. Its not bad pain. Feels like a bruise. Im very happy but still scared. Im just looking for someone in a simiular situation that is in remission. Doc wont tell me how long I can be in remission. Not even a clue. He is waiting 6 months for another petscan. I cant be happy about being in remission. I know I should be. But it's like im living day to day wondering. I would love to hear from someone that has been in remission for a few years. Thanks. Kim
Posts.Title: in Remission

Posts.Content: wow we sound alot alike. I have never been on arimidex. As far as my tumour markers. I have always been told my blood work is fine. But of course I was told that two months before I found out it had spread to my bone. This is my third time with cancer. But I have been very lucky in that each time it was caught early. The femera is working on me. I just hope it works for a very long time... --- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, email address removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html ---- email me sounds like we have alot in common God Bless kim
Posts.Title: 40 With Stage 4 Breast,with Bone Metts

Posts.Content: Hello I am 41 and also have stage 4 breast cancer. Mine was in the pelvic, back, rib and one lymph node near lung. I went on femera, zometa and a shot called soemthing lupron. Sorry not sure of the whole name.I was diagnosed in feb of 06. By april of 06 I was in remission and still am. I was told this was the best course of action as of now. If the cancer comes back and not aggresive there are more hormonal treatments. If it is aggressive the off to chemo I go. I have taken tamoxien in the past but it stopped working. I swear by the femera. It does have side effects, I have alot of pain in my joints. But not all have this.  I have been told that the average time femera works is 18-24 months. I will be hitting the 24 months in Feb 08. I have doc appt every 3 months. Blood woork and exam on one then pet scan on the next. Just a little encouraging news. My doc has a sister that has been in remission for 10 years now and still doing great. Hers had spread to bone and lungs. So dont give up!!  Im hearing more and more how woman can live with cancer. I would love to hear from someone that is a long time survivor of stage 4. Please post and give us hope. Good luck . But it sounds to me like you are getting great care.
Posts.Title: New Stage 4

Posts.Content: First thing I would suggest is a new doctor. She shouldnt have came out of that appointment with so many questions. I now have bone cancer. I have been fighting breast cancer for 10 years. Bone metts since febuary. I had two spots. one on a rib and another on my pelvis (butt). he put me on femera, zometa and a lupron shot. I am premenapausel. 3 months on these meds, the spot on my rib is gone and the one on my bottom is now a spec. Dont feel like your mom isnt going to be around. I have told this story on this site before but it gives me hope. My oncologist told me his sister had breast cancer 14 years ago, after 5 years it went to her bones. She has been in remission now for 9 years. Its not a death sentance. I dont take vitamins or do anything other then my doctor tells me to do. My biggest thing I do for myself is pray, stay positive and less stress the better. I wish there was a way I could talk to your mom. Call the american cancer society. They will hook her up with someone with the same situation that is a survivor. She will be able to talk to this person and maybe it will give her hope. But dont give into the cancer. Im going to put my email on here in case you get this and want to talk. Please feel free to email...--- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, email address removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html ----
Posts.Title: Please Help Me!!
